item.title: Trump Fired Comey Only at Request of DoJ Officials
item.description:
And today’s actions had zero to do with that. Today’s actions have everything to do with what Mr. Rosenstein, the Deputy Attorney General, who oversees the FBI Director…

— Kellyanne Conway, interview with CNN's Anderson Cooper

Claims:

Trump Fired Comey Only at Request of DoJ Officials
The Truth:
Trump later admitted he decided to fire Comey first, then sought justification from DoJ.

item.title: Early 2017 Longest the US Went Without a Treasury Secretary
item.description:
I was told yesterday, this is the longest that the nation has gone without a Secretary of the Treasury, at least in modern times. If it’s not the longest, it’s darn close to it.

— Kellyanne Conway, interview on Fox & Friends

Claims:

Early 2017 Longest the US Went Without a Treasury Secretary
The Truth:
Not even close.

Fact Checks:

PolitiFact
The United States didn’t have a president-appointed, Senate-confirmed secretary of Treasury for 34 days in 2013. Mnuchin’s confirmation could drag out longer, but Conway made this claim on Feb. 2, 14 days after inauguration.

item.title: Bowling Green Massacre
item.description:
I bet, there was very little coverage — I bet it’s brand new information to people that President Obama had a six-month ban on the Iraqi refugee program after two Iraqis came here to this country, were radicalized — and they were the masterminds behind the Bowling Green massacre. I mean, most people don’t know that because it didn’t get covered.

— Kellyanne Conway, interview with MSNBC's Chris Matthews

Claims:

Bowling Green Massacre
The Truth:
It never happened.

Fact Checks:

PolitiFact

Most importantly, there was no “massacre” in or around Bowling Green that was either carried out or attempted.

In addition, while the two men were charged with serious crimes and were sentenced accordingly, it’s important to remember that everything that happened was part of a sting operation by the FBI. This means that the people of Bowling Green were not endangered at any point, and that the entire incident can be viewed as a law-enforcement success.

item.title: Bowling Green Massacre

Bowling Green Massacre

item.title: #1 Source of Income Into Mexico Are Mexicans Working in U.S. and Sending Money Home
item.description:
Here’s the fact: The No. 1 source of income into Mexico are Mexicans working here and sending the money back.

— Kellyanne Conway, interview on CBS This Morning

Claims:

#1 Source of Income Into Mexico Are Mexicans Working in U.S. and Sending Money Home
The Truth:
U.S. purchases of Mexican goods are more than an order of magnitude larger.

Fact Checks:

PolitiFact

A projected $27 billion influx of cash from the United States into Mexico is nothing to sneeze at, and this money makes a real difference in the lives of many Mexicans who have relatives living and working in the United States, whether legally or illegally.

However, contrary to what Conway said, remittances do not rank No. 1 on the U.S.-Mexico income flow list. Rather, U.S. purchases of Mexican goods – to say nothing of services – are more than 10 times the size of remittances. And remittances also trail foreign direct investment as a source of income in Mexico.
